result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin M Conley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 26 days was granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Restiution to be paid as a condition of proabtion. Restitution from Read-in case 13CM2065 was included.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or drugs unless prescribed.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Cases 13CM2065 and 14CM100 were dismissed and read in. No Contact with any victims or businesses listed in the criminal complaints. Attend a Criminal Thinking Class. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain full time employment and/or school. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Commencing forthwith.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Justin M Conley
Current: 5879 S Honey Creek Dr. #2, Milwaukee, WI 53221 United States  (Effective: 03-28-2016)
Prior: 515 West Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Justin M Conley in court, in custody, with Attorney Eryn M Menden.   Ted S Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 (Repeat enhancer is striken).  Counts #2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.  State makes sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Menden makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   


3  1/2 - YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 26 days)
  -  1  1/2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2  YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victims or businesses listed in criminal complaints  
____Criminal Thinking course
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $1,288.36 (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)
                    &   $   405.97 on Case #13CM2065 (to be paid as a condition of probation-restitution to be paid before costs or fines)
COSTS:  $278.00  &  $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

 Condition Time:  30 days - Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith.


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Justin M Conley in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith Jr. for Atty. Eryn M Menden.   Barbara A Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on February 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Justin M Conley in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith Jr. Eryn M Menden.   Erik Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested within 10 days  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Justin M Conley in court, in custody with Attorney Richard Martin for Attorney Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for status of counsel. Attorney Menden has been appointed to represent the defendant.  Defendant advised court that no one from the Public Defender's Office has seen him yet. Attorney Martin advised court that Attorney Menden has been appointed. Court sets matter over.   Preliminary  Hearing time limits tolled.    Bail remains as fixed. Hearing scheduled for January 24, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Justin M Conley in court, in custody.  Kevin M Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 23, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
